label: AC running but not cooling
answerText: This often comes from refrigerant loss, restricted airflow, or compressor trouble. Is any room cooling at all?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician to diagnose it?

label: AC blows warm air
answerText: Warm air usually points to refrigerant issues, airflow problems, or outdoor-unit faults. Did this start suddenly or gradually?
followUpQuestion: Want me to get a technician scheduled?

label: System won't turn on
answerText: That's stressful — power, thermostat, or control-board issues are common. Are you seeing any lights or error messages?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a service call?

label: Thermostat on but nothing happens
answerText: That usually involves thermostat wiring, safety switches, or system controls. What thermostat brand do you have?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Outdoor running but no air inside
phrases: outdoor unit is running but no air
answerText: That often indicates blower failure, a control issue, or airflow blockage. Do you hear the indoor fan at all?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule service?

label: Indoor runs but outside silent
answerText: That can be a capacitor, contactor, or electrical issue. Do you hear any clicking when it tries?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC turns on and off quickly
answerText: Short cycling can come from overheating, sensors, or airflow restrictions. About how often does it restart?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a diagnostic?

label: AC runs nonstop never reaches temp
answerText: Continuous running often ties to low capacity, airflow problems, or refrigerant loss. What temperature are you trying to reach?

label: Ice on lines or coil
answerText: Icing usually involves airflow restriction or refrigerant imbalance. Is airflow from vents weak right now?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Weak airflow from vents
answerText: Weak airflow often means filter restriction, blower problems, or duct issues. Is it weak in every room?

label: One room hot rest fine
answerText: That usually points to duct balance, insulation, or a damper issue. Which room is affected most?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Upstairs hotter than downstairs
answerText: That's common with airflow balancing, attic heat load, or duct design. Do you have one thermostat or two?

label: AC noisy when it starts
answerText: Start-up noise often comes from blower looseness, motor strain, or duct movement. Is it a bang or a rattle?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Loud banging on startup
answerText: Banging typically relates to the blower assembly, motor mounts, or duct expansion. Any vibration in the closet unit?

label: Grinding from indoor unit
answerText: Grinding usually signals motor bearings, blower wheel contact, or a failing fan. Is the noise constant or intermittent?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Outdoor unit buzzing
answerText: Buzzing can indicate electrical components, fan issues, or contactor problems. Is the unit still cooling at all?

label: Squealing noise
answerText: Squealing often involves blower bearings, motor strain, or airflow restriction. Did it begin after a recent service?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Popping sound from vents
answerText: Popping is often duct expansion, pressure changes, or loose vent boots. Does it happen at startup only?

label: Musty odor when AC runs
answerText: Musty smells often come from moisture, dirty coils, or drain issues. Is the odor strongest near one vent?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Burning smell when turns on
answerText: Burning smells can involve electrical heat, motor strain, or dust burn-off. Any smoke or strong persistent odor?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule an urgent service call?

label: House feels humid with AC on
answerText: High humidity can mean airflow issues, oversized equipment, or drainage problems. Are you seeing moisture on windows?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Water leaking near indoor unit
answerText: Leaks often come from clogged drains, cracked pans, or pump issues. Is it a steady drip or pooling?

label: Water around outdoor unit
answerText: Some water is normal, but pooling may indicate drainage or freezing problems. Is ice present anywhere?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Condensate pump making noise
answerText: Pump noise can mean wear, blockage, or overflow risk. Is the pump cycling frequently or continuously?

label: Drain line clogged again
answerText: Recurring clogs often relate to algae buildup or improper slope. How often has this happened recently?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC breaker keeps tripping
answerText: Tripping can point to electrical faults, failing motors, or compressor strain. Does it trip immediately or later?

label: Furnace breaker trips during cooling
answerText: That can involve blower load, control wiring, or electrical shorting. Any recent storm or power surge?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: System stopped after power outage
answerText: Outages can affect boards, capacitors, or safety switches. Is the thermostat screen on right now?

label: Thermostat went blank
answerText: A blank thermostat often means power loss, wiring, or transformer issues. Do you have batteries in it?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Thermostat shows error code
answerText: Error codes usually point to sensors, safety switches, or control issues. What code are you seeing?

label: Thermostat says cool on but nothing runs
answerText: That often involves control signals, safety trips, or wiring issues. Is the fan set to AUTO?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Smart thermostat not controlling correctly
answerText: That can be wiring compatibility, setup errors, or control problems. Which model thermostat is installed?

label: AC works sometimes then stops
answerText: Intermittent cooling often comes from overheating parts, sensors, or electrical issues. How long does it run before stopping?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Airflow fine but doesn't cool well
answerText: That often points to refrigerant, compressor performance, or coil problems. When was the last maintenance?

label: Outside fan isn't spinning
answerText: Fan issues commonly involve capacitors, motors, or controls. Do you hear the unit humming outside?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Outside fan is weak
answerText: That can be a failing motor, capacitor weakness, or airflow blockage. Is the air from vents warm?

label: Indoor fan won't shut off
answerText: That often involves thermostat settings, relays, or control boards. Is the fan switch set to ON?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC turns on then shuts off after a minute
answerText: That behavior can come from safety trips, overheating, or control issues. Does it repeat the same pattern?

label: Unit clicking repeatedly
answerText: Repeated clicking can mean relays, contactors, or control signals cycling. Is cooling still happening?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Hissing near indoor unit
answerText: Hissing can relate to refrigerant movement, airflow, or duct leaks. Is performance noticeably worse than usual?

label: AC freezing up at night
answerText: Night icing often ties to airflow restriction or refrigerant imbalance. Is the filter recently replaced?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC smells like vinegar or sour
answerText: Sour odors often come from bacteria growth, moisture issues, or dirty coils. Is it strongest when first starting?

label: Air smells like chemicals
answerText: Chemical smells can involve electrical components, insulation, or contamination. Is the smell sharp and persistent?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Vents smell like dirty socks
answerText: That odor usually involves moisture on coils or organic buildup. Do you notice it mainly in the morning?

label: High electric bill suddenly
answerText: Higher bills often come from inefficiency, longer runtimes, or failing components. Any comfort changes lately?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC weaker than last summer
answerText: Reduced performance can come from refrigerant loss, dirty coils, or airflow issues. When was the system installed?

label: Rooms feel stuffy
answerText: Stuffy air can come from poor circulation, humidity issues, or duct restrictions. Is it worse in certain areas?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Some vents barely blow
answerText: That often indicates duct restrictions, dampers, or balancing problems. Are any rooms noticeably hotter than others?

label: Return vent is very loud
answerText: Loud returns can mean high static pressure, restrictive filters, or duct sizing issues. What filter type are you using?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Air feels dusty when AC runs
answerText: Dusty airflow may involve filtration gaps, duct leaks, or dirty coils. Any recent renovations or drywall work?

label: Allergies can HVAC help
answerText: Yes — filtration upgrades, sealing, and air-cleaning options can help. Are allergies seasonal or year-round?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Install UV lights
answerText: We do — UV solutions can reduce microbial growth in certain setups. Are you targeting odors, allergies, or both?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a visit?

label: Air purifiers for system
answerText: Yes, we offer several IAQ options based on your home and goals. Are pets or smoke a concern?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Should ducts be cleaned
answerText: Duct cleaning helps in specific cases like heavy dust, debris, or odors. Have you seen visible dust buildup?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule an inspection?

label: One vent blows much stronger
answerText: That's often duct balancing, damper position, or branch sizing. Has it always been that way?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC loud outside bothers neighbors
answerText: Noise can come from mounting, fan wear, or compressor vibration. Has the sound gotten worse recently?

label: Unit shakes when running
answerText: Shaking often relates to fan imbalance, loose mounts, or compressor vibration. Is it shaking indoors, outdoors, or both?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Thermostat reading feels wrong
answerText: Inaccurate readings can be sensor placement, calibration, or airflow issues. Is the thermostat near sunlight or a vent?

label: System blows cold then warm
answerText: Temperature swings can indicate refrigerant issues, freezing, or control problems. How long does it stay cold?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC works until afternoon then struggles
answerText: Afternoon drop-offs can involve heat load, coil issues, or refrigerant performance. What's the outside temperature like there?

label: Heat pump won't switch to cooling
answerText: That can involve reversing valve issues, controls, or thermostat setup. Do you know it's a heat pump system?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Heat pump blowing lukewarm in winter
answerText: Heat pumps can feel cooler, but issues may involve defrost or airflow. Is the auxiliary heat coming on?

label: System keeps going into defrost
answerText: Frequent defrost can relate to sensors, airflow, or outdoor coil issues. Are you seeing heavy frost outside?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Emergency heat light is on
answerText: That often indicates the system is relying on backup heat or a fault. Did anything change recently?

label: Furnace runs but air not warm enough
answerText: Low heat can come from airflow restrictions, burner issues, or control faults. Are any rooms colder than others?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Smell gas near furnace
answerText: Safety first — gas odors need immediate attention and proper handling. Are you smelling it strongly or intermittently?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to connect you to our emergency line?

label: Carbon monoxide alarm went off
answerText: That's urgent — CO alarms must be taken seriously for safety. Is everyone currently out of the home?
followUpQuestion: Please call 911 if needed. Want me to schedule an urgent inspection?

label: Furnace keeps shutting off
answerText: That can involve overheating, sensors, or venting issues. Does it shut off after a few minutes?

label: Heater makes loud boom when starts
answerText: That can involve ignition timing, burner issues, or airflow problems. Has this been happening more often?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Furnace is whistling
answerText: Whistling often comes from airflow restriction, duct pressure, or filter issues. Did you recently change filters?

label: Heater clicking but not lighting
answerText: Clicking without ignition can involve igniters, gas delivery, or safety sensors. Is the thermostat calling for heat?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Pilot light went out
answerText: Older systems can have pilot or ignition problems that need safe inspection. Do you know the furnace model age?

label: Heater smells like burning dust
answerText: Light dust burn-off can happen, but persistent odor needs checking. How long has the smell lasted?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Vents blow hot then cold then hot
answerText: Cycling can be sensor issues, overheating, or airflow restriction. Is the furnace filter older than a month?

label: Furnace fan keeps running after heat stops
answerText: That can be normal cooldown, but also thermostat or control settings. How long does it run afterward?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule a technician?

label: Can you service my brand
answerText: We service most major residential brands and common systems. What brand and approximate age is yours?

label: Work on older units from 1990s
answerText: Yes — we can evaluate older systems and discuss repair versus replacement options. Is it cooling poorly or not at all?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to schedule service?

label: Same week appointments
answerText: We'll offer the earliest available window based on your area and urgency. Morning or afternoon generally better?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to check availability?

label: What areas do you service
answerText: We cover multiple nearby neighborhoods and can confirm quickly. What's the service address or ZIP area?
followUpQuestion: Want me to check if we cover your area?

label: Are you licensed and insured
answerText: Yes — our team is licensed and insured for residential HVAC work. Is this for a home or rental property?

label: Emergency service after hours
answerText: We have options depending on the issue and availability. Is there complete loss of cooling or partial?
followUpQuestion: Do you want me to check emergency availability?

label: How fast can technician arrive
answerText: Arrival depends on the schedule and call volume, but we prioritize urgent no-cool. Is anyone elderly or medically sensitive?
followUpQuestion: Want me to check the earliest opening?

label: Service call fee
answerText: We can quote the diagnostic fee upfront and explain it clearly. Is this for AC, heat, or airflow?

label: Free estimates
answerText: Estimates vary by job type; diagnostics are different than replacements. Are you looking for repair or a new system quote?

label: Price before repairs
answerText: Absolutely — our tech explains findings and options before any work begins. Do you prefer call or text updates?

label: Financing options
answerText: Yes, we have financing options for qualifying repairs and replacements. Are you considering a repair or full replacement?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Accept credit cards
answerText: Yes — most payment methods are accepted for service and installations. Do you want receipts by email or text?

label: Send invoice copy
answerText: Of course — we can email or text invoices and documentation. What's the best email address to use?
followUpQuestion: Anything else I can help with?

label: Receipt for landlord
answerText: No problem — we'll provide clear documentation of diagnosis and recommendations. Is the landlord approving repairs directly?

label: Work with home warranties
answerText: We can coordinate depending on your warranty provider and terms. Which warranty company is it through?

label: Manufacturer warranty coverage
answerText: Coverage depends on registration, age, and part type; we can verify. Do you know the install date?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Unit under 10 years
answerText: Yes, age often affects parts coverage and repair strategy. Are you the original homeowner or a new owner?

label: Check if under warranty
answerText: Yes — we can check with model and serial information onsite. Is the issue cooling, heating, or noise?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Deposit required
answerText: Deposits depend on the work scope; diagnostics typically don't require one. Is this a standard service visit?

label: Cancel or reschedule
answerText: Yes — just give us notice and we'll adjust your appointment. Do you prefer morning or afternoon windows?
followUpQuestion: Want me to help with that now?

label: Technician call before arriving
answerText: Yes — technicians usually notify you ahead of arrival when possible. What's the best cell number for updates?

label: How long does diagnostic take
answerText: Most diagnostics take under an hour, depending on access and symptoms. Is the unit in an attic or closet?

label: Need to be home for service
phrases: do I have to be there
answerText: Ideally yes, but we can discuss access and authorization options. Is there a lockbox or gate code?

label: Have pets should I do anything
answerText: Just secure pets for safety and clear access to equipment. Are there indoor and outdoor units we'll access?

label: AC in attic does that matter
answerText: Attic access helps planning; we'll note entry type and safety. Is there a pull-down ladder available?

label: Work on condo system
answerText: Yes, we handle many condo setups and building requirements. Do you need COI paperwork for management?

label: Certificates of insurance COI
answerText: Yes, we can supply COIs when buildings require them. Who should we send it to?

label: HOA needs proof of license
answerText: No problem — we'll provide the required documentation promptly. What's the HOA email contact?

label: Service mini split systems
answerText: Yes, we service many ductless mini-splits and multi-zone systems. How many indoor heads do you have?

label: Mini split not cooling one room
answerText: That can involve the indoor head, refrigerant balance, or controls. Is only one head affected?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Mini split remote not working
answerText: That could be remote issues, sensor problems, or communication faults. Do you have a wall controller too?

label: AC smells moldy when starts
answerText: Moldy odors often come from moisture and buildup around coils or drains. Is it worse after rain?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Water dripping from vent
answerText: Dripping vents can indicate high humidity, duct sweating, or insulation issues. Is it near an exterior wall?

label: Ceiling stain near unit
answerText: That's often related to condensate drainage or pan overflow. Has the stain grown recently?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC drain pan rusted
answerText: Rust can lead to leaks and needs evaluation before it worsens. Has it overflowed in the past?

label: System blowing dust suddenly
answerText: Sudden dust can come from duct leaks, filter gaps, or construction debris. Any recent remodeling work?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Filter gets dirty very fast
answerText: Fast-loading filters can mean high dust, return leaks, or duct issues. Do you have pets indoors?

label: What filter should I use
answerText: Filter choice depends on airflow needs and allergy goals; we can advise onsite. What size and MERV are you using?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Can high MERV filter hurt system
answerText: In some homes, restrictive filters raise pressure and reduce airflow. Are you noticing weaker airflow lately?

label: System louder after filter change
answerText: That can happen if pressure increased or the filter fits poorly. What filter thickness are you using?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC leaking refrigerant can you fix
answerText: Yes — we locate leaks, confirm pressures, and recommend the right repair path. Is cooling noticeably reduced?

label: Do you recharge refrigerant
answerText: We can, but we first identify why levels are low and address the root cause. Has it needed recharge before?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Is refrigerant recharge expensive
answerText: Cost depends on refrigerant type, system size, and whether a leak repair is needed. Do you know your refrigerant type?

label: Work on R22 systems
answerText: We can service them and discuss options since R-22 is limited. Are you looking for repair or planning replacement?

label: Replace old AC instead of repair
answerText: We'll compare repair costs, efficiency, and reliability so you can decide confidently. How old is the system?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: How long should AC last
answerText: Lifespan varies, but maintenance, usage, and environment matter a lot. About how old is your current unit?

label: What SEER rating for replacement
answerText: We'll recommend efficiency based on budget, comfort goals, and utility rates. Are you staying in the home long-term?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Do ductwork repairs
answerText: Yes — we repair, seal, and balance ducts to improve comfort and efficiency. Are rooms unevenly hot or cold?

label: Do duct replacement
answerText: Yes, when needed; we evaluate design, leakage, and insulation first. Is the ductwork old or damaged?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Ducts in attic affect performance
answerText: Attic ducts can lose efficiency if unsealed or poorly insulated. Are you noticing hot rooms upstairs?

label: Bedroom gets no airflow at night
answerText: That may involve duct balancing, dampers, or pressure differences with doors closed. Do you sleep with the door shut?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC struggles when doors closed
answerText: That points to airflow balance and pressure issues between rooms. Does opening doors improve comfort quickly?

label: AC makes house feel dry
answerText: Dry air can be seasonal or airflow-related; we can assess humidity balance. Are you running heat frequently too?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Skin dry throat hurts indoors
answerText: That can relate to humidity levels, filtration, or ventilation. Do you have a humidifier installed?

label: Install whole house humidifier
answerText: Yes — humidifiers can improve comfort, especially during heating season. Are you on a furnace or heat pump?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Install whole house dehumidifier
answerText: Yes — dehumidifiers help with comfort, odors, and moisture control. Is humidity worst in summer or year-round?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Bathroom fan doesn't remove humidity
answerText: Ventilation issues can affect overall humidity and comfort. Is this a newer home with tight insulation?

label: Air feels heavy not temperature
answerText: Heavy air often ties to humidity control, ventilation, or airflow distribution. Is it worse in the afternoon?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC blowing cold but still feels hot
answerText: Comfort can be humidity, airflow, or thermostat placement, not just temperature. Are you feeling sticky indoors?

label: Thermostat in bad spot can move
answerText: Yes, relocation is possible and can improve control accuracy. Is it near a kitchen, window, or hallway?

label: Install smart thermostat
answerText: Yes — we install and set them up correctly for your system type. Which thermostat brand are you considering?

label: Nest thermostat acting weird
answerText: Smart thermostat issues often involve wiring, settings, or compatibility. Is your system a heat pump by chance?

label: Thermostat keeps losing wifi
answerText: That's often network-related, but we can confirm power stability and wiring too. Is the screen ever flickering?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC won't respond to thermostat
answerText: That can be control wiring, board issues, or thermostat faults. Are you seeing any system error indicators?

label: AC short cycling after thermostat change
answerText: That can happen with wiring differences or configuration errors. Was the thermostat recently replaced or reprogrammed?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: New AC doesn't feel as cold
answerText: New systems cool differently; comfort depends on airflow and humidity control. Are run times longer or shorter now?

label: New unit quieter should I worry
answerText: Quieter operation is often normal with newer designs and variable components. Is the home reaching set temperature?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a checkup?

label: Seasonal tune-ups
answerText: Yes — tune-ups help prevent breakdowns and keep efficiency strong. Are you looking for cooling or heating maintenance?

label: What's included in maintenance
answerText: We inspect, test, clean key components, and check performance metrics. Is your priority reliability or better comfort?

label: Maintenance plan available
answerText: Yes — plans include scheduled visits and priority service options. Would you want reminders for spring and fall?
followUpQuestion: Want me to share plan details?

label: Can maintenance lower electric bill
answerText: It often helps by improving airflow, cleanliness, and performance under load. Have you noticed longer runtimes recently?

label: How often should system be serviced
answerText: Most homes benefit from twice-yearly checks for cooling and heating seasons. Is your system used year-round?

label: Can you clean evaporator coil
answerText: Yes — coil condition impacts airflow and efficiency, and we'll assess access safely. Are you seeing weak airflow or icing?

label: Can you clean condenser coil
answerText: Yes — outdoor coil cleanliness helps performance and reduces strain. Is the outdoor unit near shrubs or sand?

label: Outdoor unit covered in debris
answerText: Debris can reduce airflow and efficiency, so we'll assess and restore proper performance. Has cooling dropped noticeably?

label: AC makes rattling sound at vent
answerText: Rattles can be loose registers, duct vibration, or airflow pressure issues. Is it one vent or multiple?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Vent cover whistles loudly
answerText: Whistling usually indicates high air pressure, restricted returns, or duct sizing issues. Did it start after a filter change?

label: Return grille sucking really hard
answerText: Strong suction can signal restricted airflow or high static pressure. How many return vents does your home have?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Remodeled now airflow worse
answerText: Remodels can affect duct paths, returns, and pressure balance. Were walls moved or vents relocated?

label: Added room now AC struggles
answerText: Added load may exceed capacity or require duct changes. Was the system resized after the addition?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: AC can't keep up during hot days
answerText: That can be capacity, insulation, duct leakage, or equipment performance issues. What temperature does it hold at peak heat?

label: Cools fine at night not daytime
answerText: Daytime issues can reflect heat gain, airflow limits, or refrigerant performance. Any west-facing windows or high ceilings?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Unit sounds like straining
answerText: Straining sounds can be motor load, airflow restriction, or compressor stress. Is the system also tripping breakers?

label: AC starts then loud hum
answerText: Humming often involves capacitors, electrical components, or motor issues. Does the fan spin up afterward?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC making high pitched noise outside
answerText: High-pitched sounds can come from fan motors, bearings, or vibration. Has the unit been serviced recently?

label: System vibrates the wall
answerText: Vibration can be mounting, fan imbalance, or compressor movement. Is the outdoor unit on a pad or brackets?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC smells mildew after rain
answerText: Rain-related odors often involve moisture, duct intrusion, or drainage problems. Is the odor near one return vent?

label: Dripping noise in wall
answerText: Dripping sounds can indicate condensate drainage issues or duct sweating. Are you seeing any water spots nearby?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: AC leaking from copper line area
answerText: Moisture there can be sweating, icing melt, or insulation failure. Is the line cold with visible frost?

label: AC line cold and wet is normal
answerText: Some condensation can be normal, but heavy sweating suggests insulation or airflow issues. Is there puddling below it?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Compressor loud is it failing
answerText: Not always, but louder compressors can signal wear or strain. Has cooling performance dropped recently?

label: AC 15 years old should I worry
answerText: At that age, reliability and efficiency often decline; we'll give honest options. Are repairs becoming frequent?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a consultation?

label: Second opinion on another quote
answerText: Yes — we'll review symptoms and inspect so you're not guessing. Was the quote for repair or replacement?

label: Another company said need new system
answerText: Sometimes yes, sometimes not; we'll verify with real diagnostics. What problem were you experiencing?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a second opinion?

label: Replace capacitors and contactors
answerText: Yes — those are common electrical repairs once properly confirmed. Is the outdoor unit not starting consistently?

label: Repair blower motors
answerText: Yes — we test airflow and motor health, then recommend the right fix. Is airflow weak or completely absent?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Repair control boards
answerText: Yes — when boards fail, we confirm safely and replace only if necessary. Are you seeing intermittent shutdowns?

label: Unit under warranty no paperwork
answerText: That's fine — we can often verify using model and serial details onsite. Are you the original owner?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule a technician?

label: Keep common parts on truck
answerText: We stock many common residential parts, but it depends on your model. What brand and approximate age is it?

label: How do I know if urgent
answerText: No-cool, burning smells, repeated tripping, or leaks deserve quick attention. Which symptom is happening right now?
followUpQuestion: Want me to check urgent availability?

label: Baby at home getting hot
answerText: Understood — we'll treat comfort-sensitive situations with priority where possible. What's the indoor temperature currently?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule urgent service?

label: Elderly parent in home
answerText: Thanks for telling me — we'll do our best to prioritize based on safety and need. What temperature is the house?
followUpQuestion: Want me to schedule urgent service?

label: Tenant can I schedule service
answerText: Yes — we can coordinate, but authorization may be needed depending on the landlord. Who approves repairs and payment?

label: Landlord contact tenant directly
answerText: Absolutely — we can schedule with them while keeping you informed. What's the tenant's best phone number?
followUpQuestion: Want me to set that up?

label: Text updates instead of calling
answerText: Yes — text updates work great for arrival times and approvals. What's the best cell number to use?
followUpQuestion: Anything else I can help with?

label: Send appointment confirmations
answerText: Yes — we confirm appointments and provide update notifications when available. Do you prefer text or email confirmation?

label: How to prepare for technician visit
answerText: Clear access to the thermostat, indoor unit, and outdoor unit helps us move fast. Any gate or lock codes?

label: Will technician wear shoe covers
answerText: We aim to keep homes clean and professional during service. Are there any special home rules we should follow?

label: Work around my work schedule
answerText: We'll offer time windows that fit, based on availability in your area. Mornings or afternoons usually better?

label: First appointment available
answerText: Great — we'll grab the soonest opening that matches your location and need. What's the service address?

label: Latest appointment possible
answerText: We can check later windows depending on route schedules and workload. Are afternoons generally easier for you?

label: Only have short time window
answerText: Understood — we'll try to match your availability with our open slots. What's your preferred two-hour range?

label: Request specific technician
answerText: Yes — if that technician is available, we'll do our best to assign them. Who would you like to request?
followUpQuestion: Want me to check their schedule?

label: How long will repairs take
answerText: Timing depends on diagnosis and parts, but we'll explain options clearly. Is this an AC, heat, or airflow issue?

label: Call before expensive repairs
answerText: Always — nothing proceeds without your approval, and you'll get clear options. Do you prefer phone or text approvals?

label: Weekend appointments available
answerText: Weekend availability can vary, but we'll check what's open. Would Saturday or Sunday be the preference?

label: What time window for service calls
answerText: We typically offer arrival windows rather than exact times for routing efficiency. Morning or afternoon works better?

label: Can you come in next hour
answerText: We'll check immediate availability, but it depends on the route and current calls. Is it complete no-cool?
followUpQuestion: Want me to check emergency availability?

label: Not sure if repair or maintenance
answerText: No problem — symptoms guide that; we'll route correctly after a couple details. Are you having comfort issues right now?
followUpQuestion: Want me to help figure it out?

label: Tune up before summer
answerText: Great idea — tune-ups catch problems early and help efficiency. Do you prefer a morning or afternoon appointment window?

label: Maintenance for heating system
answerText: Perfect — heating maintenance improves safety, reliability, and performance. Is this a furnace or heat pump system?

label: System working but want it checked
answerText: Preventive checks are smart; we verify performance and look for early warning signs. Any specific concern you noticed?

label: New home can you inspect HVAC
answerText: Yes — we can evaluate operation, airflow, and any installation concerns. Is this a pre-purchase or post-purchase inspection?

label: Selling house need HVAC report
answerText: We can document condition and findings after inspection for your records. When is your inspection deadline?

label: Want to schedule what do you need
answerText: Just the service address, best contact number, and a preferred window. Morning or afternoon usually easier?
